title: UNGA Resolution 181
summary: Partition plan for Palestine, recommending the creation of independent Arab and Jewish states and a special international regime for the city of Jerusalem.
relevance: Established the original UN framework for Palestine

title: ICJ Order (2024)
summary: Provisional measures in the case concerning Application of the Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide in the Gaza Strip (South Africa v. Israel).
relevance: Obligates Israel to prevent genocide and ensure humanitarian access

title: Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court
summary: Treaty that established the International Criminal Court (ICC). It defines the ICC's jurisdiction over genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes, and the crime of aggression.
relevance: Provides legal framework for prosecuting war crimes and crimes against humanity

title: Fourth Geneva Convention
summary: Protects civilians in time of war. It is particularly relevant to occupied territories, outlining the obligations of the occupying power towards the civilian population.
relevance: Defines protections for civilians in occupied territories

title: UNGA Resolution 3379
summary: Resolution equating Zionism with racism. It was later revoked by Resolution 46/86 in 1991.
relevance: Historical UN position on Zionism and racism

title: UNSC Resolution 242
summary: Called for the withdrawal of Israeli armed forces from territories occupied in the recent conflict and for the termination of all claims or states of belligerency.
relevance: Foundation for land-for-peace principle

title: UNSC Resolution 478
summary: Condemned Israel's attempt to alter the character and status of Jerusalem through its 'Basic Law' making Jerusalem its capital.
relevance: International rejection of Israeli annexation of Jerusalem

title: ICJ Advisory Opinion (2004)
summary: Legal consequences arising from the construction of a wall in the Occupied Palestinian Territory. The Court found the wall to be contrary to international law.
relevance: Declared Israeli separation barrier illegal under international law

title: Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide
summary: Defines genocide as a crime under international law and obliges signatory states to prevent and punish it.
relevance: Legal basis for genocide allegations

title: International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR)
summary: Multilateral treaty committing states parties to respect the civil and political rights of individuals, including the right to self-determination.
relevance: Protects fundamental civil and political rights

title: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights (ICESCR)
summary: Multilateral treaty committing states parties to work toward the granting of economic, social, and cultural rights to individuals.
relevance: Protects economic, social, and cultural rights

title: UNGA Resolution 194
summary: Resolution dealing with the status of Jerusalem and calling for the right of return of Palestinian refugees.
relevance: Establishes Palestinian right of return

title: UNSC Resolution 2334
summary: Condemned Israeli settlements in the Palestinian territories occupied since 1967, including East Jerusalem, as having no legal validity.
relevance: International condemnation of Israeli settlements

title: UNGA Resolution ES-10/21
summary: Demanded an immediate humanitarian ceasefire in Gaza and called for unhindered humanitarian access.
relevance: Most recent UN call for Gaza ceasefire

title: ICC Prosecutor Statement (2021)
summary: Statement by the ICC Prosecutor on the opening of an investigation into the Situation in Palestine.
relevance: Initiated ICC investigation into Palestinian situation

title: Third Geneva Convention
summary: Deals with the treatment of prisoners of war.
relevance: Protects POWs in armed conflicts

title: First Geneva Convention
summary: Protects wounded and sick armed forces in the field.
relevance: Protects wounded combatants

title: Second Geneva Convention
summary: Protects wounded, sick and shipwrecked members of armed forces at sea.
relevance: Protects naval combatants

title: UNGA Resolution 3236
summary: Reaffirmed the inalienable rights of the Palestinian people in Palestine, including the right to self-determination.
relevance: Affirmed Palestinian right to self-determination

title: UNSC Resolution 1860
summary: Called for an immediate, durable and fully respected ceasefire in Gaza leading to the full withdrawal of Israeli forces.
relevance: Post-2008 Gaza conflict ceasefire resolution

title: UNGA Resolution 67/19
summary: Granted Palestine non-member observer State status in the United Nations.
relevance: Elevated Palestine's status at UN

title: UNSC Resolution 1322
summary: Deplored acts of violence, particularly the excessive use of force against Palestinians, and called for an immediate cessation of violence.
relevance: Response to Second Intifada violence

title: UN Charter
summary: Constitution of the United Nations, establishing principles of international peace and security, self-determination, and sovereign equality of states.
relevance: Establishes UN principles of self-determination and sovereignty applicable to Palestine

title: Hague Convention IV
summary: Laws and customs of war on land, including protections for occupied territories and civilian populations. Establishes foundational principles of international humanitarian law.
relevance: Foundational laws of occupation and warfare applicable to Palestinian territories

title: UNSC Resolution 2720
summary: Called for increased humanitarian aid to Gaza through additional routes and crossings, demanding 'immediate and sustained' humanitarian pauses.
relevance: Most recent UNSC resolution on Gaza humanitarian crisis following October 2023 escalation

title: UNGA Resolution ES-11/1
summary: Emergency special session resolution demanding immediate humanitarian pauses and corridors in Gaza, and calling for respect for international law.
relevance: Immediate UN General Assembly response to 2023 Gaza escalation

title: UNSC Resolution 672
summary: Condemned Israel for deporting Palestinian civilians and called for their immediate return, emphasizing violations of the Fourth Geneva Convention.
relevance: Condemned forced displacement of Palestinians during First Intifada

title: ICJ Advisory Opinion on Legal Consequences (2024 Draft)
summary: Updated advisory opinion on the legal consequences of Israel's occupation and settlement policies in the Occupied Palestinian Territory.
relevance: Comprehensive legal assessment of Israeli occupation and obligations under international law
